title: A New Look At America's Founding
teaser: Historian Joseph Ellis's latest book takes us beyond the Declaration of Independence, to what happened after the war ended.
contentencoded:
Historian Joseph Ellis is well known for his work on the era of the American revolution and the founding fathers. His latest book, “The Quartet: Orchestrating The Second American Revolution, 1783-1789,” takes us beyond the Declaration of Independence and tells the story of what happened after the war ended, the creation of the Articles of Confederation, the Constitutional Convention and the drafting of the Bill of Rights.

  • Related: Jeremy Hobson’s interview with Joseph Ellis about the summer of 1776

Guest

  • Joseph J. Ellis, Pulitzer Prize-winning historian, author and professor at Williams College. His latest book is “The Quartet: Orchestrating The Second American Revolution, 1783-1789.”
